definitions: To charge (an internal combustion engine) with a supercharger.
To charge (a battery) at a high rate.
To fill or imbue with an excess of anything.
To make something more powerful or effective.
examples: The mechanic will supercharge the engine for better performance.
We need to supercharge the battery before the trip.
The new policy aims to supercharge economic growth.
Her enthusiasm tends to supercharge the whole team.
